page.title: 07TRAGO MILLS,STOVER (CONTD).
page.content: with fish ducks and coots.Moorhens and swans nest on the little islands. Great care has been taken to ensure that the wild flowers,shrubs and trees have been preserved and planted,and this has saved the habitat of many birds,animals and insects. In pens can be seen rare pheasants,peacocks,deer, rabbits and budgerigars.Picnic areas and an enclosed childrens playground complete the scene of what must be a 'dream concept'.{Trago Mills}and the inhabitants of{Coldeast}are in dispute over a proposed new road going under the A.38 linking{Trago Mills}with the Liverton road.{Coldeast represenatives are concerned over any traffic increase.However it would ease congestion on the Newton Abbot/Bovey Tracey road junction to{Trago.}Only time will tell who will win.See Text 2 {Coldeast Village.
